intro: Belotia occidentalis, commonly known as the western belotia, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of North America. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Belotia occidentalis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
